page.title: 18CHESTERTON GRAVEYARD
page.content: In Chesterton today several of the graves are very personal.One notable one belongs to a villager who was an enthusiastic cyclist and has a miniature cycle on his grave.Another belongs to a horse breeder who was also an amateur jockey.Each year some of his horses are brought to the graveside so that he can "see" them.Most of the oldest tombstones are lichen encrusted and worn by the weather.Inside the church are two very different tombs.Humphrey Peyto and his wife Anne have their eleven children depicted above the tomb,including one wrapped in a shroud.His relatives Edward and Elizabeth Peyto are shown in a Roman style setting.
